revised_title: Investigations on the Action of Vaso-Motor Nerves in Striated Muscle
tldr: The author investigates the effects of nerve stimulation on blood circulation in striated muscles, observing that during muscle tetanus, there is a sudden increase in blood flow followed by a complete stoppage. The author also examines the effects of nerve stimulation on arteries and capillaries in curarized muscles, finding that stimulation causes a rapid and marked dilatation of the arteries.
